definition[0]: when you do not have to pay tax on part of what you earn, especially because you use the money for a particular purpose
example[0]: You can get tax relief on private health insurance premiums.
definition[1]: the right not to have to pay tax on part of a sum of money that is earned or received. Sometimes the tax is paid first, and then given back by the authorities
example[1]: The bill would give tax relief to middle-income individuals.
example[2]: Borrowers canclaim tax relief on their pension contributions.
